column4: how do I get the mplayer plugin for firefox working? synaptic says that it's installed but when I try to play a quicktime video it comes up in a black box and in white it says: (no video)
how do I get the mplayer plugin for firefox working? synaptic says that it's installed but when I try to play a quicktime video it comes up in a black box and in white it says: (no video)
do you have the codecs installed ?
I think so, but how do I check?
you know what, scratch that. Is there an easy way to get the VLC plugin for firefox working? (That already has all the plugins built in). synaptic says that it's installed, so how do I enable it?
try removing the other players-mozilla plugins and leaving only the vlc one
I uninstalled all plugins except for vlc and when I reloaded the page with a quicktime movie, firefox crashed
lovely ;-),  I don'T know if  vlc supports quicktime but whatever,    what version of ubu are you running ?
Edgy still. Havn't gotten round to upgrading yet
chouldn'T be that hard in edgy,  remove mplayer, remove vlc,  the pluggins will be removed as well,  then install the mplayer-mozilla pluggin
btw, I have a question about that. when I upgrade to edgy, is it going to need a complete new install or does it retain the files and just update the appropriate files?
it will intall a bunch of new packages, remove a bunch, but your settings customixing and data should remain
